flap.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a thin flat piece of cloth, paper, skin etc that is fixed by one edge to a surface, which you can lift up easily
flap.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: A loose flap of skin covered the wound.
flap.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: the noisy movement of something such as cloth in the air
flap.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a part of the wing of an aircraft that can be raised or lowered to help the aircraft go up or down
flap.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: if a bird flaps its wings, it moves them up and down in order to fly
flap.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to move quickly up and down or from side to side, often making a noise
flap.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: The flags were flapping in the breeze.
Flap your arms to keep warm.
flap.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to behave in an excited or nervous way
